com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net

Class Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.blogspot.debukkitsblog.net.Client

  • public class Client
extends java.lang.Object
    A very simple Client class for Java network applications
    originally created on March 9, 2016 in Horstmar, Germany
    Version:
    2.3.4
    Author:
    Leonard Bienbeck

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Client(java.lang.String hostname, int port)
      Constructs a simple client with just a hostname and port to connect to
      Client(java.lang.String hostname, int port, int timeout, boolean autoKill, boolean useSSL, java.lang.String id, java.lang.String group)
      Constructs a simple client with all possible configurations
      Client(java.lang.String hostname, int port, java.lang.String id)
      Constructs a simple client with a hostname and port to connect to and an id the server uses to identify this client in the future (e.g. for sending messages only this client should receive)
      Client(java.lang.String hostname, int port, java.lang.String id, java.lang.String group)
      Constructs a simple client with a hostname and port to connect to, an id the server uses to identify this client in the future (e.g. for sending messages only this client should receive) and a group name the server uses to identify this and some other clients in the future (e.g. for sending messages to the members of this group, but no other clients)

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void onConnectionGood()
      Called on the listener's main thread when there is no problem with the connection and everything is fine.
      void onConnectionProblem()
      Called on the listener's main thread when there is a problem with the connection.
      void onLog(java.lang.String message)
      By default, this method is called whenever an output is to be made.
      void onLogError(java.lang.String message)
      By default, this method is called whenever an error output is to be made.
      void onReconnect()
      Called on the listener's main thread when the client logs in to the server.
      void registerMethod(java.lang.String identifier, Executable executable)
      Registers a method that will be executed if a message containing identifier is received

      Sends a message to the server using a brand new socket and returns the server's response

      Sends a message to the server using a brand new socket and returns the server's response

      Sends a message to the server using a brand new socket and returns the server's response
      void setMuted(boolean muted)
      Mutes the console output of this instance, stack traces will still be printed.
      void start()
      Starts the client.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String hostname,
              int port)
        Constructs a simple client with just a hostname and port to connect to
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname to connect to
        port - The port to connect to

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String hostname,
              int port,
              java.lang.String id)
        Constructs a simple client with a hostname and port to connect to and an id the server uses to identify this client in the future (e.g. for sending messages only this client should receive)
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname to connect to
        port - The port to connect to
        id - The id the server may use to identify this client

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String hostname,
              int port,
              java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String group)
        Constructs a simple client with a hostname and port to connect to, an id the server uses to identify this client in the future (e.g. for sending messages only this client should receive) and a group name the server uses to identify this and some other clients in the future (e.g. for sending messages to the members of this group, but no other clients)
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname to connect to
        port - The port to connect to
        id - The id the server may use to identify this client
        group - The group name the server may use to identify this and similar clients

      • Client

        public Client(java.lang.String hostname,
              int port,
              int timeout,
              boolean autoKill,
              boolean useSSL,
              java.lang.String id,
              java.lang.String group)
        Constructs a simple client with all possible configurations
        Parameters:
        hostname - The hostname to connect to
        port - The port to connect to
        timeout - The timeout after a connection attempt will be given up
        autoKill - Whether the program should exit after 30 failed connection attempts
        useSSL - Whether a secure SSL connection should be used
        id - The id the server may use to identify this client
        group - The group name the server may use to identify this and similar clients

    • Method Detail

      • setMuted

        public void setMuted(boolean muted)
        Mutes the console output of this instance, stack traces will still be printed.
        Be careful: This will not prevent processing of messages passed to the onLog and onLogError methods, if they were overwritten.
        Parameters:
        muted - true if there should be no console output

      • start

        public void start()
        Starts the client. This will cause a connection attempt, a login on the server and the start of a new listening thread (both to receive messages and broadcasts from the server)

      • sendMessage

        public Datapackage sendMessage(Datapackage message,
                               int timeout)
        Sends a message to the server using a brand new socket and returns the server's response
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send to the server
        timeout - The timeout after a connection attempt will be given up
        Returns:
        The server's response. The identifier of this Datapackage should be "REPLY" by default, the rest is custom data.

      • sendMessage

        public Datapackage sendMessage(java.lang.String ID,
                               java.lang.String... content)
        Sends a message to the server using a brand new socket and returns the server's response
        Parameters:
        ID - The ID of the message, allowing the server to decide what to do with its content
        content - The content of the message
        Returns:
        The server's response. The identifier of this Datapackage should be "REPLY" by default, the rest is custom data.

      • sendMessage

        public Datapackage sendMessage(Datapackage message)
        Sends a message to the server using a brand new socket and returns the server's response
        Parameters:
        message - The message to send to the server
        Returns:
        The server's response. The identifier of this Datapackage should be "REPLY" by default, the rest is custom data.

      • registerMethod

        public void registerMethod(java.lang.String identifier,
                           Executable executable)
        Registers a method that will be executed if a message containing identifier is received
        Parameters:
        identifier - The ID of the message to proccess
        executable - The method to be called when a message with identifier is received

      • onConnectionProblem

        public void onConnectionProblem()
        Called on the listener's main thread when there is a problem with the connection. Overwrite this method when extending this class.

      • onConnectionGood

        public void onConnectionGood()
        Called on the listener's main thread when there is no problem with the connection and everything is fine. Overwrite this method when extending this class.

      • onReconnect

        public void onReconnect()
        Called on the listener's main thread when the client logs in to the server. This happens on the first and every further login (e.g. after a re-established connection). Overwrite this method when extending this class.

      • onLog

        public void onLog(java.lang.String message)
        By default, this method is called whenever an output is to be made. If this method is not overwritten, the output is passed to the system's default output stream (if output is not muted).
        Error messages are passed to the onLogError event listener.
        Override this method to catch and process the message in a custom way.
        Parameters:
        message - The content of the output to be made

      • onLogError

        public void onLogError(java.lang.String message)
        By default, this method is called whenever an error output is to be made. If this method is not overwritten, the output is passed to the system's default error output stream (if output is not muted).
        Non-error messages are passed to the onLog event listener.
        Override this method to catch and process the message in a custom way.
        Parameters:
        message - The content of the error output to be made
